Mullach Clach a'Bhlair

Hear pronunciation Press to hear pronunciation

Mullach Clach a'Bhlair has an insignificant summit towards the southern end of the great plateau that stretches northwards to Sgor Gaoith and eastwards to Cairn Toul. Its finest features are seen on the approach from beautifully-wooded Glen Feshie, with Coire Garbhlach.

 You have not climbed Mullach Clach a'Bhlair.

Region: Cairngorms

Altitude: 1019 metres

Users' Rating:
  • Currently 2.56/5
Rating: 2.6/5 (97 votes cast)

You must be registered and signed-in to vote

Detailed route description and map

Mullach Clach a Bhlair from Glen Feshie

Other routes and challenges

Its position on the vast Moine Mhor plateau - and easy terrain underfoot - mean that the Mullach can feasibly be included in several other Munro outings. The most popular combination is with Sgor Gaoith to the north, but the very fit may combine it with the Monadh Mor range.

Walker-friendly accommodation in the area

Kingussie / Newtonmore Hotels

Kingussie / Newtonmore B&B

Kingussie / Newtonmore cottages

Cairngorms hostels
